Key: ...do... Shido, wake up.
...Mm. Is class over?
School is over. Everyone went home.

(I awoke on my desk, raising my head
to find that no one else was around.)
You're right. Did homeroom end?
You fell into a deep slumber.

*yawn*... Crap, I messed up. Did Tama-chan
say anything?
I have your assignment.

...Seriously? You could've woken me up,
Origami.
Apologies. I enjoyed watching you sleep.
Huh? You did? Did I look weird...?

Not at all. I lost track of time watching
you. You seemed so content.
You're embarrassing me. Maybe I was dreaming.
Dreaming? What kind?
Well, you―
Nothing. It's a secret.

So the dream is related to me? Then, I must
insist you tell me.

(I had a dream in which I confessed my
love for Origami under sunset. We looked
so happy together.)
No, it's embarrassing. I can't tell you.
I'm curious.

On another note, we're hanging out tonight,
right? Let's get out of here.

Very well, but I want you to tell me what
you dreamt about.
Forget about that! Come on, let's go!
Oh, Shido...
Where do you want to go today, Origami?
If it is with you, anywhere.

Then, how about karaoke? We haven't
gone in a while.

I have no objections. I practiced a new song
that I am sure you will enjoy.

Whoa. Can't wait. I've got a few in mind,
too.
I look forward to it.

(If our relationship continues like this, then
maybe―just maybe―my dream will become
a reality.)

(The path ahead of us has only just begun.
Every day, it looks brighter and brighter.)
